text: This whole movie is a mistake

JUST HORRIBLE when I head about the megamind 2 movie i got so excited just to be unbelievably disappointed the animation is just so lazy the humor is just unfunny and corny the story is weak as well all i got to say.
There is no Easter bunny, there is no tooth fairy, and there is no megamind sequel

In the history of cinema, a sequel must feel as genuine as the first film. Else this would cause huge complications. Well, I feel sad for DreamWorks because the Megamind vs. the Doom Syndicate is a sequel that was entirely ruined. This is likely due to the choppy animation style and the rushed planning, leading to a direct-to-video television animated film. Strange name right?
Let's just say DreamWorks wanted to keep the budget silent enough, because they knew it was not going to work. So they distributed the film primarily through Peacock, which supports the direct-to-video television production. This is a red flag that tells you the movie is not worth it. But anyways, the visual style looks like DreamWorks evolved backwards for a bit. The first Megamind had clear visuals, realistic textures, professional rendering and sound creation, and supported the stereoscopic 3D viewing format to push the limits of cinema. The animation had feeling, just like Pixar, and wasn't a cashgrab. The second one, once the trailer was seen, felt choppy, cringe, full of animation glitches, unrealistic like it was a decade ago, and was rigged by streaming platforms. This is what happens when the direction isn't interested in the movie, leading DreamWorks employees to disrupt the entire project. I feel dissapointed about one of my animation companies when they fumble a sequel to a successful movie.
P. S. You should've brung Metroman to do the arm swings too

The animation is a major turn-off for me because it’s just so 'wonky,' and I've seen that a lot of other people feel the same way. The movements are off, and it really ruins the viewing experience.
This movie is so bad I couldn't even have the heart to goon to my king megamind. 😢

This is the reason why DreamWorks can't be trusted with long awaited sequels more than a decade in the making.
The CGI is terrible, the villains are rip-offs of Miraculous Ladybug and no returning cast members.
This was never meant to be made, it was only done because DreamWorks wanted a Bad Guys TV series on Netflix, but for some reason it didn't materialise.
But this is a blasphemous disgrace to Megamind, end of.
